3942 <!-- CONTENT -->
4043 <div class="intro-content">
4144     <h2 class="heading-medium">1. Overview</h2>
42      <p>You can apply for an Access to Work grant if you have a disability or health condition that causes you difficulty doing your job.</p>
43      <p>The grant can be used to pay for <a href="intro3">special equipment or support</a> to help you: </p>
45      <p>You can apply for an Access to Work grant if you have a long-term disability or health condition that makes it difficult for you to do your job.</p>
46      <p>The grant can pay for <a href="intro3">special equipment or support</a> to help you: </p>
4447     <ul class="list-bullet">
45        <li>do work tasks, either in your current job or for a new role</li>
48        <li>do work tasks</li>
4649       <li>get to and from work</li>
4750     </ul>
48    <p>It can also be used to help you in a job interview if you have communication difficulties.</p> 
4951     <p>You can't get a grant to help with business start-up costs.</p>
50      <p>The grant doesn’t have to be paid back and won't affect any other benefits you get.</p>
52      <p>The grant doesn’t have to be paid back.</p>
53    <h2 class="heading-medium">Other benefits</h2>
54        <p>You might not get a grant if you already get:</p>
55    <ul class="list-bullet">
56      <li>Incapacity Benefit</li>
57      <li>Job Seekers Allowance</li>
58      <li>Employment and Support Allowance</li>
59      <li>Severe Disability Allowance</li>
60      <li>Income Support</li>
61      <li>National Insurance Credits</li>
62    </ul>
5163 </div>
5264

5567      </nav>

3838 <div class="intro-content">
3939    <h2 class="heading-medium">2. Eligibility</h2>
40     <p>Access to Work grants are only available if you live and work in England, Scotland or Wales. There's a different system in <a href="http://www.nidirect.gov.uk/access-to-work-practical-help-at-work">Northern Ireland.</a></p>
41     <p>You must be 16 or over and either:</p>
42    <ul class="list-bullet">
43      <li>about to start a job or work trial</li>
44      <li>in a paid job or self-employed (you can’t get a grant for voluntary work)</li>
45    </ul>
40     <p>You can only apply for an Access to Work grant if you live and work in England, Scotland or Wales. There's a different system in <a href="http://www.nidirect.gov.uk/access-to-work-practical-help-at-work">Northern Ireland.</a></p>
41 
4642   <h2 class="heading-medium">Your condition</h2>
4743   <p>Your disability or health condition must affect your ability to do your job or mean you have to pay work-related costs. For example, if you need to buy computer equipment or have to take taxis because you can’t use public transport.</p>
4844   <h2 class="heading-medium">Other benefits</h2>
…… 
5753   </ul>
5854   <h2 class="heading-medium">Changing jobs</h2>
5955   <p>You may be able to take any special equipment that's been paid for with an Access to Work grant with you if you change jobs.</p>
60    <p>If you get regular grants (eg for travel to work) you'll have to apply for a new grant.</p>
56    <p>If you get a grant for travel costs you'll have to apply for a new grant if you change your place of work.</p>
6157 </div><!-- .intro-content -->

3841 <div class="intro-content">
39      <h2 class="heading-medium">3. What you'll get</h2>
40      <p>How much you'll be offered depends on your condition and how much help you need.</p>
42      <h2 class="heading-medium">2. What you'll get</h2>
43      <p>How much you'll be offered depends on how much help you need.</p>
4144     <p>A grant can pay for things like:</p>
4245   <ul class="list-bullet">
4346         <li>changes to equipment you have to use for your job</li>
…… 
4649         <li>someone to help you in your workplace, eg a support worker</li>
4750         <li>work coaching or mentoring</li>
4851         <li>disability awareness training for your colleagues</li>
49          <li>someone to help you communicate at a job interview, eg a sign language interpreter</li>
50          <li>moving special equipment if you change your job</li>
52          <li>moving any special equipment if you change your job</li>
5153     </ul>
52      <h2 class="heading-medium">Changes to Access to Work</h2>
53      <p>From 1 October 2015 the maximum grant that you could be offered will be £40,800 per year.</p>
54    <p>If you already have a grant or are given one before 1 October 2015 that's worth more than £40,800 it'll be reduced in April 2018.</p>
54      <h2 class="heading-medium">Maximum grant</h2>
55      <p>The most you can get as an Access to Work grant is £40,800 per year.</p>
56    <p>If you have a grant that's worth more it'll be reduced in April 2018.</p>
5557 </div>

39        <h2 class="heading-medium">4. Apply</h2>
41        <h2 class="heading-medium">3. Apply</h2>
4042
4143       <p class="font-small" id="grant">To get an Access to Work grant you must:</p>
4244
4345       <ul class="list-bullet" aria-labelledby="grant">
4446         <li>be 16 or over</li>
45          <li>live and work in England, Scotland or Wales</li>
46          <li>have a job or a job interview</li>
47          <li>have a long term disability or health condition</li>
47          <li>live and work in England, Scotland or Wales - there's a different system in <a href="http://www.nidirect.gov.uk/access-to-work-practical-help-at-work">Northern Ireland</a></li>
48          <li>have a job</li>
49          <li>have a long-term disability or health condition</li>
4850       </ul>
49  
5051       <p class="font-small">Department for Work and Pensions will contact your employer when you apply and an assessor might have to visit you at work.</p>
5152       <details>
52          <summary><span class="summary">About long term health conditions</span></summary>
53          <summary><span class="summary">About long-term health conditions</span></summary>
5354         <div class="panel-indent">
5455           <p id="health">Your health condition or disability doesn't have to be permanent but you must either:</p>
5556           <ul aria-labelledby="health" class='list-bullet'>
5657             <li>have had it for at least a year</li>
5758             <li>expect it to last at least another 12 months from when you apply</li>
5859           </ul>
59            <p>You don't usually need to give any medical evidence of your condition as part of your application.</p> 
6060         </div>
6161       </details>
